result.query:
Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: The artificial carbon dioxide (CO 2 ) photoreduction into useful chemicals utilizing solar energy demands the stable photocatalysts with high-efficiency charge separation and effective CO 2 adsorption capacity.For all this, for the first time, Bi 2 WO 6 photocatalysts with atomically thin structure along with hydrophobic and nonpolar surface are successfully designed and prepared using CTAB as assistant.The ultrathin feature with short diffusion distance significantly facilitates the charge separation.The

important role of hydrophobic surface in photocatalytic CO 2 reduction.We have also conducted a 5 h-long photocatalytic experiment on BWO-C2 with N 2 and water vapor only in accordance with the reported conclusive procedure 44.The results are shown in Fig. 3a, no CH 4 , or CO were detected during the illumination, which further confirms that the generated products are completely stemmed from photocatalytic CO 2 reduction and CTAB-modified surface is stable.Conversely, the hydrophilic surface is more

the stability and reusability of photocatalyst.The BWO-C2 was washed by ethyl acetate and dilute sulfuric acid solution to remove the CTA ions.The XPS spectra indicate that the CTA ions are removed, while the Br -are still absorbed on photocatalyst, as shown in Fig. S21a-b.The photocatalytic CO 2 reduction rate of BWO-C2 distinctly decreases after washing (Fig. S21c).It is because that the removal of CTA results in the change of hydrophobic surface, which further confirms the important role of hydrophobic

glass was put in the reactor, and the air in the system was removed completely by vacuum treatment.Subsequently, a mixture of high purity CO 2 gas and water vapor were purged into the reactor by passing the CO 2 through a water bubbler.The light source was 300 W Xe lamp (CEL-HXF300, Au-Light, China) equipped with AM 1.5.The reaction temperature was kept at 25 C by the circulating cooling water system.The operating reaction pressure during irradiations is under the atmosphere pressure.During each

the charge separation.The hydrophobic surface, modified by nonpolar long carbon chains of CTA , boosts both the mass-transfer and adsorption of CO 2 , meanwhile suppressing the H 2 O adsorption.Hence, the prepared photocatalyst exhibits a high-efficiency photocatalytic conversion of CO 2 in H 2 O vapor without co-catalyst due to high CO 2 concentration and sufficient photogenerated carriers.The photocatalytic mechanisms including adsorption concentration and activation process of CO 2 are further revealed

result.query:
Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.
Possible Choices:
Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
Lamp: ['Fluorescent', 'Mercury', 'Halogen', 'Mercury-Xenon', 'LED', 'Tungsten', 'Xenon', 'Tungsten-Halide', 'Solar Simulator']
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
Light_source: XXX
Lamp: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: glass was put in the reactor, and the air in the system was removed completely by vacuum treatment.Subsequently, a mixture of high purity CO 2 gas and water vapor were purged into the reactor by passing the CO 2 through a water bubbler.The light source was 300 W Xe lamp (CEL-HXF300, Au-Light, China) equipped with AM 1.5.The reaction temperature was kept at 25 C by the circulating cooling water system.The operating reaction pressure during irradiations is under the atmosphere pressure.During each

nitrogen cooled HgCdTe (MCT) detector.The spectra in absorbance units were acquired with a resolution of 4 cm -1 , using 32 scans.The reaction chamber was equipped with the circulating cooling water system.The irradiation was introduced through a liquid light guide (Au-Light, China) that connects to a 300 W Xe lamp (CEL-HXF300, Au-Light, China).Firstly, high purity CO 2 was continuously passed through a water bubbler to take a mixture of CO 2 and water vapor into the chamber at 8 mLmin for 60 min.After

at 8 mLmin for 60 min.After that, the inlet and outlet valves of the reaction chamber was closed.Prior to the light irradiation, the samples were kept in dark at CO 2 and H 2 O atmosphere for 60 min.The sample was under illumination (300 W Xe lamp) for 60 min.The spectra were collected every 10 min, and the light was temporarily blocked during the collection.The temperature of the reactor was kept at 25 C by the cooling water circulation. observe the secondary electron cutoff.Ultraviolet-visible diffuse reflectance spectra (DRS) were collected on a Hitachi U3010.The time-resolved photoluminescence spectra were recorded with Edinburgh Instruments FLS920 with an excitation wavelength of 300 nm, and decay curves were fitted by decay curves of ExpDec1 function. In-situ diffuse reflectance infrared Fourier transform spectra (DRIFTS) were recorded on Thermo Nicolet 6700 FT-IR spectrometer equipped with a liquid nitrogen cooled HgCdTe (MCT)

reduction activity tests of the photocatalysts were carried out in a 250 mL Pyrex glass reactor (PQ256, Beijing Perfectlight, China).Firstly, 30 mg of as-prepared samples and 5 mL of deionized water were added to a watch glass, with an area of 23.75 cm 2 , and then ultrasonic mixing for 10 min.The above suspension was evaporated at 60 C in drying oven to form the uniform film.The design of photocatalytic reactor was shown in Fig. S2.Prior to the light irradiation, the watch glass was put in the reactor,
